thread.title: Storage firms will be tech earnings winners: Expert
thread.title_full: Storage firms will be tech earnings winners: Expert

author: Jacob Pramuk
title: Storage firms will be tech earnings winners: Expert
text:
What to expect from tech
Discussing whether strong earnings from tech company can take the market higher, with Timothy Ng, Clearbrook Global Advisors, and Sandy Lincoln, BMO Asset Management U.S.
In an up-and-down technology earnings seasons, storage businesses will likely outshine other segments like semiconductors, one expert said Monday.
"Storage is going to be very attractive at this point in time," said Tim Ng, chief investment officer at Clearbrook Global Advisors, on CNBC's "Power Lunch."
Getty Images EMC Corp. world headquarters in Hopkinton, Massachusetts. Data storage segments are key growth drivers for big-cap tech companies like Amazon , which posts quarterly results later this week. Legacy hardware firm Dell's roughly $67 billion acquisition of cloud computing company EMC shows the strong demand for growing storage businesses, Ng said.
Read More Dell to buy EMC in deal worth about $67 billion
He contended semiconductor firms could struggle in this earnings cycle. The sector has seen record consolidation amid sales sluggishness and sagging stock prices.
Investors should not judge the technology sector as a whole but focus on revenue growth for individual companies, added Sandy Lincoln, chief market strategist at BMO Asset Management, on "Power Lunch."
